channel.title: CVE Feed for Cisco -- Cisco NX-OS Software for Nexus 6000 Series
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Cisco -- Cisco NX-OS Software for Nexus 6000 Series

item.title: CVE-2018-0378|2024-09-16T17:23:35.897Z -- cisco -- cisco%20nx-os%20software%20for%20nexus%206000%20series
item.description: A vulnerability in the Precision Time Protocol (PTP) feature of Cisco Nexus 5500, 5600, and 6000 Series Switches running Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to a lack of protection against PTP frame flood attacks. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending large streams of malicious IPv4 or IPv6 PTP traffic to the affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS condition, impacting the traffic passing through the device.
